body:
Cuboid, Cylinder, and etc. selection region for spawning: Will reduce cluttering and attempted spawn blocking.

Mob disguises: Oooooh yeeeaaaaah~

mob disguise:
    who: red (* gives it to every team)
       mob: wither skeleton
       potion effect: wither (Every hit gives wither to the inflicted)
       attribute: (See attributes below)
   


Item attributes: Attributes that a certain item has like: generic.maxHealth, increases maximum health.

 generic.followRange, increases range that mobs will lock onto you.

 generic.knockbackResistance, increases knock  back resistance.

 generic.movementSpeed, increases movement speed. 

generic.attackDamage, increases attack damage.

Could be used in a syntax like this:

0: item: iron axe
 title: 'Example of syntax'
enchants:
 - damage all:5
 - dig speed:5
 - durability:1
attribute:
- generic.movementSpeed:add (or subtract):3 (you can use decimals)

A mob spawning syntax.

A syntax that allows trading with villagers and enabling villagers.

replies.body:
I like them but complex YML making brings on some weird problems that not even the Map Developers can fix at times (For instance, Dark Trot, Dark Trot 2, War Never Changes 2, VTOL, TNT Warz, Tenacity and according to Cows, Ka-Boom! are broken, and we don't really know what's up with those YMLs, I personally have been trying to fix them a hundred times, same with Cows, but the result is the same, it ends up crashing the dev server and not working at all. War Never Changes is the only fully-working map we have from you...

I think region spawns are already possible, but it currently remains as unknown for me.
Mob disguises sound cool but I'm not really a fan of that idea...
Maximum health, movement speed and attack power are already possible by giving custom status effects on Loadout section in YML (check docs.avicus.net for more info).
The villager and mob system sounds really interesting, however I'm leaning more towards the village idea.
